conclusion: Analyze forces acting on basketball: gravity and air resistance.
Force-time graph with three segments: 0-1.5s at 1.5N, 1.5-6s at 1.0N, 6-8s at 0.5N.
Basketball experiences gravity and air resistance; air resistance is lambda times gravitational force.
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is same for each collision.
Ratio of velocities during collisions is 1/(1 + lambda).
Condition: 0 < lambda < (H-h)/(H+h), ensures lambda is within range.
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is 1/(1 + lambda).
